alert.note: Alert for Coast Range of Northwest Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 23 at 3:28AM PST until December 23 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, significant icing. Additional ice accumulations of one tenth to three tenths of an inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 5 above zero. * WHERE...Coast Range of Northwest Oregon. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 PM PST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 AM PST early this morning. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel will be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures should warm above freezing Friday night.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
